metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13705 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in extensions in Google Chrome prior to 78.0.3904.70 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension to leak cross-origin data via a crafted Chrome Extension.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
